title: 106_hr554
content: SECTION 1. ROLLOVER CONTRIBUTIONS FROM DEFERRED COMPENSATION PLANS OF STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS. Rollovers From Section 457 Plans allow employees to transfer balance from eligible deferred compensation plans of eligible employers through rollover distributions. Employees can transfer property received in a distribution to an individual retirement plan, and if the transferred amount consists of the distributed property, it will not be taxable in the year of payment. Rules similar to those in sections 401(a)(31), 402(c), and 402(f) apply. Section 457 distribution requirements are amended with exceptions provided in subsection (e)(16). Conforming amendments are made to sections 72(o)(4) and 219(d)(2) of the Code. The Code is amended to include section 457(e)(16) in various sections such as 401(a)(31)(B), 402(c)(4), and 408(a)(1). The Code is amended to include section 457(e)(16) in various sections such as 401(a)(31)(B), 402(c)(4), and 408(a)(1). Amendments include inserting references to eligible deferred compensation plans in different sections of the Code, such as 457(b) and 457(e)(16). The Code is amended to include section 457(e)(16) in various sections such as 401(a)(31)(B), 402(c)(4), and 408(a)(1). Amendments apply to distributions after December 31, 1998. SEC. 2. State and local governments eligible under section 401(k). Amends eligibility criteria for State and local governments under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Effective for plan years starting after December 31, 1998.
